turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Good to see you again, Leo.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: I can't say it's a surprise.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: And I certainly can't say it's pleasant.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: As soon as I heard Elvis was on the loose, you came to mind.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: I checked your release date.  I never liked coincidences.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: And I don't like deviations from plans, Leo, as I'm sure you re-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Yeah, I had a small problem with members of our side murdering civil-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...I lost all my squeamishness at Leav- ...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...-enworth.  I'll have no compunction at all about using this.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Hm.  The wind's northwest.  That oughta be...Seattle.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Or I may be wrong.  The breeze could be gusting south.  That'd be Billings...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...maybe even Salt Lake, not to mention Casper...

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Knowing you, Brynner, you've got buyers waiting to buy! You're not gonna use that...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: And I'm warning you, Leo.  Don't test me. Get your men and your machines off my radar screen in five, or three million people will die.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Tell the choppers we're lifting off!

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Get 'em on line, then stall.  Long can't have gotten far.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Vaughn, Burke, move to the end of the street.  Fan out and work your way back to the motel.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: There's nothing in here, sir.  They got away with it.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: All right.  Let's clear the mess and move out.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Besides, how are we gonna sell something we don't have?

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Nothing has changed, I assure you both. The Army still thinks we got Elvis.  They had a tactical withdrawal.  It's just those two amateurs now.  Do you really want to concede a hundred million dollars to them?

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: EXT. FORT LEAVENWORTH - TEN YEARS LATER - DAY.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. U.S. RESEARCH LABORATORY/LONG'S OFFICE - NIGHT.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. U.S. RESEARCH LABORATORY/STORAGE AREA/FREEZER VAULT - NIGHT.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Move.  This is already affecting our schedule.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Dennis, radio the bikes.  I wanna know if so much as a squirrel...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Well.  It appears someone's been lying to us.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Dutiful citizens, you have something which I have waited years for.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: You have no idea what you're in possession of, do you?

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: And so Missoula's prodigal son returns.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Of which we have more than enough.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: All right.  Tell the pilot we'll be a half-hour.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Carl, establish contact with that deputy we met earlier.  He'll be more useful now.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: This was supposed to be a...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: You have ten percent of a hundred million dollars comin' your way.  I think we can impose on you for a little overtime.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: Sir, all potential customers have been informed of the delay.  Fur-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: No.  A pair of average citizens have decided to risk their lives for their country.  I almost remember what that feels like.

turns.speaker: VAUGHN
turns.text: You can't fire on them.  You're gonna detonate the crystals.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Just when we have all the cards, Vaughn.  Take these two behind the van.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: We're gonna use them for demonstration  footage.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Having witnessed the effects myself, I can assure you it'll be very useful when the bidding starts.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Get 'em in the  middle of the dam.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Stay put.  Keep the camera trained on...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: This river ends at a hydro dam...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...in Missoula.  All we need to do is get to Mason before anyone else does.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Carl, Dennis, get out of sight.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Officer Pappas, I'm glad you're here.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Mind if you tell me what's goin' on?

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: I'm Colonel Brynner, U.S. Special Operations Com-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: We were called in by the Jerome base...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...to pursue a man who's stolen government proper-...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Yeah, he's wanted in connection with a death this morning at the Jerome...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Long went missing from the Tech Center this morning along with a very dangerous...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Hemmings!  Sam, I thought I told you to close up shop and be ready to move up the island by night-...

turns.speaker: HEMMINGS
turns.text: Yes, Captain Brynner, you did, but-but--

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...what, Sam?  Can't I go down to the loading dock for a few hours without coming back to find a major...

turns.speaker: HEMMINGS
turns.text: Uh, with all due respect, sir, Dr. Long told me to prep the field for detonation at...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Jesus Chri--  We're on a very slippery slope here, Sam.  A covert military operation riddled with civilian...

turns.speaker: HEMMINGS
turns.text: You don't think it's that bad, do you, sir?  I mean, Long's spent the last two years developing his defoliant.  The stuff can't even kill crabgrass yet.

turns.speaker: HEMMINGS
turns.text: ...out here, captain.  Don't you think the guys deserve a break?

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: We gotta get help.  Aw, fuck!  Damn.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Well, then, how about a cup of coffee, Darlene?

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I assume you want that to go.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Uh, you wanna hunt outta season, it's cool with me.  But mostly, well, they just take a six...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...and a rifle.  You, on the other hand...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...look like you're after something more dangerous.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Actually, I was just looking for a restroom.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Doc Long.  Yeah, I know him.  Weirdo guy. He comes in from...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Contrary to what Dr. Long may have told you, this is neither...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...your concern nor your fight.  Relinquish the package and you can go.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I don't know what the hell...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: I want you to look at one another...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: ...and ask a simple question -   Are you actually prepared...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Because if you don't give me that cylinder, your lives will end...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: And I can't guarantee the end will be quick.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Elvis is fuckin' dead, man.  Get yourself some CDs.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: I got someone who's anxious to talk to you, Mr. Mason.

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Then meet me at the dam in fifteen minutes.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You try anything, it goes in...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: It's a little late for matinee heroics, Mason.  Just give me the con-...

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: Why?  You're a nothing, nobody!  Why?

turns.speaker: BRYNNER
turns.text: They took that life away and left me with nothing.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...-son.  Of all the days for you to show up late.  First, the idiot April calls in sick.  Then I got a bad tooth...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...and then my night man shows up when he feels like...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Darlene, it's five-thirty.  Now, I worked late for you this mornin', and you didn't wanna spring for over-...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Oh.  Well, I have got to get to the dentist be-...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...-fore he closes, which means you're gonna have to cover the grill and the floor.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Mm.  It doesn't take a genius.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: And don't give him any ice cream...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...like April.  It gives him gas. And make sure there's  two pots of coffee...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...ready before the morning crowd blows in.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...ready before the morning crowd blows in.  I got it...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Oh, caught a few, lost a few.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Story of my life.  Well, one thing you won't lose is that friend of yours back there, I'll tell you that.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: Oh, you're two of a kind, doc.  Oh, he may not have your sheepskins, and...

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: ...well, most of the time he looks like something the cat might have dragged in, but, you know...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Uh, we both like to fish.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: His I know.  Yours I don't have a clue.  But if it wasn't for you, I think he'd have drifted right on through this town.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: You know, I have yet to get a simple cup of coffee and a meal in this place, Darlene.

turns.speaker: DARLENE
turns.text: And you ain't gonna start now.

turns.speaker: DENNIS
turns.text: Sir, I got Taipei grindin' on me here. How long is this supposed to ta--?

turns.speaker: GOMEZ
turns.text: Major, we've gotta seal that tunnel!  Major!

turns.speaker: GOMEZ
turns.text: ...we're gonna seal that tunnel!  I want it air-...

turns.speaker: GOMEZ
turns.text: Colonel, sir, who the hell is this guy?

turns.speaker: GOMEZ
turns.text: Sir, we can't just let him get away with this!

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Gomez, you fight the battles you can win.  Now, we've been outmaneuvered here.  Brynner's next move is gonna be to get Elvis out of the country and sell him to the highest bidder.  To do that, he has to have planned an exit point.  That's where we intercept him.  That's where we make our play.  Now you and your men back off.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Here's what I want you to do.

turns.speaker: GOMEZ
turns.text: Get ready to take it out!

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: It must've happened right after we left.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Missoula's reporting the refrigerator truck as a stolen vehicle.  I told you Mason was walking shit.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Pappas, that other guy was unloading ice cream into a freezer.  Now, what could he have to do with a military scientist, huh?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: The sooner you get up the lab, the sooner you'll figure it out.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Deputy Art Lewis, Jerome County Sheriff's Department.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: I don't suppose you'd like to tell me what this is all about.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: I will tell you what I...

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: What the hell are you talkin' about...

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Well, I've got Dr. Long's body down at the coroner's office.

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: One of our units is pursuing a suspect up the thirty-...

turns.speaker: LEWIS
turns.text: Mason?  No, he's a soda-jerk drifter, a hamburger flipper.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: It could be a cover, I suppose.

turns.speaker: PUMPER
turns.text: Morning, doc.  Awful early, aren't ya?

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Couldn't sleep, Pumper.  Is everything, uh, all right tonight?

turns.speaker: PUMPER
turns.text: There's nothin' goin' on out there, doc...except maybe the occasional fly fisherman.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Been trying to figure out your secret.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Yeah.  Ten months we've been fishin' this river together.  We use the same equipment, more or less...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...but you pull twice as many fish out of the water as I do.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: And I'm good at this.  Been doing it since I was a kid.  But you, I don't know.  Somehow you think...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: No, that's not possible, Mason.  The trout...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: How can we ever hope to win against the trout?

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: There's only one way you can do it, Mason.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Turn the power of the hunter against him.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...create a piece of bait that sends the fish's instincts into overdrive...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: ...forcing him to strike.  And only then does our noble friend realize that the prey...can bite...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Some people might say you're readin' an awful lot in-...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: The compound has to be kept cold...

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: Never let it reach fifty degre-degrees.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: You're the only one I can trust.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: The only one who understands what this me-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Tryin' to remember somethin' somebody once told me about tyin' a fly.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: And only then does our noble friend realize...

turns.speaker: SWEENEY
turns.text: Well,  Costello's finished with the stability profile, but Abbott is still chewing on the load file.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: So reaction temperature is fifty degrees.

turns.speaker: SWEENEY
turns.text: Well, your prediction was on the nose.

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: How much longer for the range and power projections?

turns.speaker: SWEENEY
turns.text: I don't know.  Um, he's working, but there's a lot of data. Maybe...another hour?

turns.speaker: LONG
turns.text: We don't have an hour.  We're already supposed to be shut down.

turns.speaker: SWEENEY
turns.text: I got eight thousand yards. Radius is five...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: What we gave Brynner on the dam was a phony!

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Mason, what is the temperature of Elvis?!

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: If you're not out of there soon, I have got to seal the...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: There's a vent shaft leading straight up.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Okay, I'll have a chopper meet you at the top.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: So, Mason, last Wednesday night, uh...were you out...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: ...uh, drifting around like the trash you are, or were you here workin'?

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: If it was Wednesday night, I was workin'.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Do you recognize this young man?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: ...badge someday, then you can ask the questions.  Until then...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: ...selling this young man beer Wednesday night.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I don't sell beer to minors.  I take that kinda thing...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Mason, you wouldn't know the truth if it bit you.  We've got your whole record.  We know about the-the conviction for vagrancy...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: I didn't sell the boy any...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Shut your mouth until I tell you...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You know, I gotta tell you.  That really bothers me, somebody calls me "son."

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Then how about if I call you "ass-...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: I said let me see your hands now!

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: You redneck idiot, do you have...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Yeah, asshole.  I'm puttin' a murder suspect and a guy who...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: ...on the other end of this phone.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: His name's Vitelli.  Talk to him.  He's right out-...

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Wait.  Listen to me, Pappas.  If you don't let us by...

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: EXT. U.S. ARMY RESEARCH LABORATORY/GUARD GATE - JEROME - NIGHT.
